trial_identification.studytitle: Genetic link between Fibrous Dysplasia and Intramuscular Myxoma in patients suffering from Mazabraud syndrome
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Genetic link between Fibrous Dysplasia and Intramuscular Myxoma in Mazabraud syndrome

interventions.interventions: 4 cases of Mazabraud syndrome will be asked to give blood sample in pathology for genetic study.. Only a single blood sample will be taken from each participant.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Finding common genetic mutations in patient suffering from both Fibrous Dysplasia and Intramuscular Myxoma, known as Mazabraud syndrome
primaryOutcome.timepoint: One blood sample will be taken.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Knowing common genetic mutations will help in distinguishing fibrous dysplesia from malignant tumours
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: One blood sample will be taken.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Detecting those mutations which lead to fibrous dysplasia in those who are suffering from multiple intramuscular myxoma
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: One blood sample will be taken.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Patients with confirmed diagnosis of both Intramuscular Myxoma and Fibrous Dysplesia (which is known as Mazabraud syndrome)

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Mazabrauds syndrome is a rare syndrome in which benign intramuscular myxomas occur in association with fibrous dysplasia of bone. (Macfarlane, Lew et al. 2007) There is increased risk of developing osteosarcoma or fibrosarcoma in Fibrous Dysplasia with Mazabraud syndrome. The recognition of this entity is important for appropriate management of the patient. In this project, we will perform genetic tests on 4 patients with Mazabraud syndrome to look for any genetic link between Fibrous Dysplasia (FD) and Intramuscular Myxoma (IM). In order to do genetic study, we need to arrange taking blood sample from these patients.
